image.altText: A close shot of a woman's eyes as she looks to the right of frame with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: When Nadene's 16-year-old son was sent to juvenile detention, it was meant to keep him and the community safe. Instead, he lost his life.

title.children: As the inquest into Cleveland Dodd's death begins, his mother hopes it brings answers and accountability

image.altText: Bags of flour strewn exploded and strewn all over the floor with man standing in the middle in front of a wall with bullet holes

props.synopsis: An Australian aid worker is reportedly been killed in an air strike in central Gaza, according to Palestinian medical officials.

title.children: Australian aid worker in Gaza killed by Israeli air strike, Palestinian officials say

image.altText: An aerial view of a large newly built house in an estate with an open two car garage and green lawns.

props.synopsis: New data shows landlords are buying every third property that hits the market, as house values continue to grow. Some experts say it's keeping house prices out of reach for young people and first home buyers.

title.children: Landlords 'over-represented' in property market as house prices rise for 14th straight month

image.altText: Indigenous woman with a black shirt that reads 'Australian Nuclear Free Alliance'.

props.synopsis: For decades, Australians have been hesitant to embrace nuclear power – but there are signs attitudes might be shifting, as younger Australians see climate change as their generation's existential threat.

title.children: The nuclear debate isn't just a political one – there's also a generational divide

image.altText: From the ground up, a large brown brick apartment complex stands, with a cloudy blue sky backdrop.

props.synopsis: Many strata managers know that in the long absence of proper regulation by government, the industry has become addicted to the routine exploitation of apartment owners and the easy profits that flow as a result.

title.children: As a strata management veteran spoke about ethics, his company's suspect activities were under investigation

image.altText: Aged care workers accompany a resident down the hallway of their facility

props.synopsis: A lecturer from the University of WA says a recently-secured pay rise for aged care workers is unlikely to change the way sector is valued, and that more work to address unconscious bias is required.

title.children: Pay rise alone unlikely to change the way society values female-dominated aged care industry, expert says

image.altText: A teenager with a brown bob speaks into a megaphone

props.synopsis: When you come of age in Israel, you are expected to serve in the military. But for some young citizens, they have decided to risk the rejection of their families and time in prison rather than join the fight in Gaza.

title.children: As her dad watched on, 18yo Sofia told the IDF she could not fight in Gaza. Then she went to jail

image.altText: People crowd around a ruined building as smoke rises from it

props.synopsis: Iran has blamed Israel for the strike that destroyed the consular section of its embassy in Damascus, killing everyone inside including a senior commander.

title.children: Senior commander killed in suspected Israeli air strike on Iranian  consulate in Syria

image.altText: Andrew Giles stands next to Clare O'Neil at a press conference

props.synopsis: Labor senators have joined the chorus of criticism of the federal government’s unsuccessful attempt to ram contentious immigration legislation through parliament last week, arguing the bill was so serious that it needed proper scrutiny.

title.children: Labor senators join criticism of the government's rushed immigration legislation

image.altText: Dark storm clouds gather over a beach in Victoria as people walk along the sand.

props.synopsis: A cold front moving through Victoria, New South Wales and Tasmania is expected to be followed by heavy rain, storms and potentially the first east coast low for 2024.

title.children: A band of rain and storms is sweeping across south-eastern states ahead of a more significant weather event

image.altText: A middle-aged Indigenous woman with dyed red hair looks at the camera with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal elder who recently worked for NT Police is among a group of Aboriginal Territorians calling for more to be done to address racism within the force.

title.children: Aboriginal elder calls for NT Police unit to apologise to community over 'disgraceful' award

image.altText: Man standing in the water holding a box jellyfish with his bare hands

props.synopsis: A mysterious and excruciating illness was striking down beachgoers in North Queensland until the 1960s, when a doctor and a "puny little boy" went to extraordinary lengths to solve the mystery.

title.children: The jellyfish detective who discovered the Irukandji by stinging volunteers — including his 10-year-old son

image.altText: A  stainless steel sink full of dirty coffee cups and dishes, with a dish rack and glasses on the left-hand side.

props.synopsis: Although most people don't deliberately set out to show disregard for their co-workers, poor hygiene practices can take a toll on the physical health and mental wellbeing of employees.

title.children: What a dirty office kitchen says about your workplace (and possibly you, too)

image.altText: People walking along a street in Tokyo lined with Japanese flags.

props.synopsis: Japan spent years as an economic powerhouse before spending decades under threat from recessions. But seemingly overnight, its fortunes appear to have changed — and it could provide a glimpse into the future for us all.

title.children: Why the sun is rising on a new Japanese dawn

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann smiles while walking outside court, wearing a suit and tie and glasses.

props.synopsis: Today, Network Ten will ask the Federal Court to consider new evidence in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case over coverage of Brittany Higgins's rape allegation — the judgement for which was to be delivered on Thursday.

title.children: Network Ten's application to introduce new evidence in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation could delay judgement

image.altText: An SES crew working on a tree.

props.synopsis: A woman had a lucky escape after being swept into stormwater drain in Daylesford last night as heavy rain moved in across Victoria. The SES has taken hundreds of calls for help.

title.children: Woman 'miraculously' pulls herself from neck-deep water amid torrential Victorian rain

image.altText: havana embassy

props.synopsis: The Kremlin has dismissed a report that Russian military intelligence may be behind the mysterious "Havana syndrome" ailment that has afflicted US diplomats and spies globally.

title.children: Investigation links mystery 'spy' illness to Russian intelligence

image.altText: A graphic showing a young boy looking up at an illustration of a brain

props.synopsis: The federal government has released a draft of its national autism strategy, which aims to improve life outcomes for autistic Australians.

title.children: Autistic people die 20 years earlier than the rest of Australia. Can a national plan turn that around?

image.altText: A stock market watcher stands in front of an ASX board.

props.synopsis: The ASX200 is tipped to open slightly higher today, on its first day back from a four-day Easter break, after a mixed session on Wall Street overnight.

title.children: ASX tipped to open slightly higher, US records stronger-than-expected manufacturing activity

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: RBA to change the way it implements its cash rate target
Insurance giant IAG appoints new group general counsel
Almost four in 10 people taking out a mortgage now are landlords

image.altText: A man holds up a brochure saying: "A simple bowel test could save your life."

props.synopsis: Disruptions to health care during the height of the pandemic could be having an impact nearly two years on, with the nation's cancer rates.

title.children: COVID-19 stopped Australians testing for bowel cancer. Here's why we should start again

image.altText: Tim Tszyu looks to one side

props.synopsis: Sebastian Fundora's manager promises Tim Tszyu a rematch after the controversial world championship bloodbath in Las Vegas.

title.children: 'Your rematch is ready when you are': Manager that Tszyu branded a 'weasel' promises Aussie a Fundora rematch

image.altText: Group of women do a figure four stretch while facing a mirror in a gym studio.

props.synopsis: Rent rises and cost-of-living pressures have seen more people cancelling their gym memberships. One fitness group thinks making gym sessions tax-deductible will keep more Australians healthy and is lobbying the government to get on board.

title.children: Tax-deductible gym memberships? This group reckons it's a no-brainer

image.altText: Alice Springs night curfew

props.synopsis: The NT's police union has advised its members that the government's emergency declaration may be unlawful, after receiving legal advice.

title.children: Police union receives legal advice that Alice Springs youth curfew is unlawful

image.altText: Freshwater beach

props.synopsis: The five packages were discovered on Monday morning at Freshwater and Curl Curl beaches near Manly.

title.children: Five parcels believed to contain cocaine wash up on two beaches in Sydney's north

image.altText: Jack Beasley smiling and wearing a backwards cap.

props.synopsis: Belinda Beasley is worried by the number of students who are carrying knives to school and fears a fatal stabbing is only be a matter of time unless things change.

title.children: Four years after Jack Beasley was fatally stabbed, his mother is worried history will repeat

image.altText: A gurney sits next to an ambulance outside Launceston General Hospital.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Ombudsman has lambasted the state's health department for its "obstruction" to a patient's request to access their full medical record, urging the department to "cease this practice immediately".

title.children: Don't sue us: Tasmanian Health Department accused of 'quid pro quo' over a patient's attempt to access their own records

image.altText: Shai Bolton, Jake Stringer and Brodie Smith during round three games.

props.synopsis: The Tigers and Bombers claim inspirational breakthrough wins, the Demons flex their muscle in Adelaide while the Crows face an early-season crisis. Here are the biggest talking points from every game of round three.

title.children: AFL Round-Up — Yze's Tigers arrive, Bombers find their spirit and Crows hit early crisis

image.altText: A view showing a building that has been burned with cars and an emergency vehicle in front of it.

props.synopsis: Russia's top security agency says it has broken up a "terrorist cell" whose members allegedly provided weapons and cash to gunmen who launched a deadly assault on a Moscow concert hall.

title.children: Russia says it arrested four more Moscow concert hall attack plotters

image.altText: A man in a chequered shirt holds his son with shaggy blonde hair. Behind them is a fence and purple flowers.

props.synopsis: A collective selling local farm produce is forced to close in Victoria's South Gippsland region, as consumers across the country move to "essentials-only" shopping.

title.children: Shoppers choose 'survival' over support for local farmers as cost of living bites hard

image.altText: People walk around pieces of metal strewn on a remote road with trucks in the background

props.synopsis: Police and security officials say that 12 people have been arrested in connection to the attack and some are linked to militant groups.

title.children: A dozen people arrested over deadly suicide bombing in Pakistan

image.altText: A building with a walkway between two sides destroyed and hanging in the air

props.synopsis: After a two-week raid, the Israeli military withdraws from Gaza's largest hospital, saying it was a successful operation but leaving behind several dead bodies and vast destruction.

title.children: Israeli troops leave Gaza's Al-Shifa Hospital a wreck in sea of rubble

image.altText: A main street in Camberwell showing pedestrians, cars and a tram.

props.synopsis: The state government has outlined the 10 areas across Melbourne where it wants to collectively build thousands of homes. But data shows it will take some effort to turn around the status quo.

title.children: Melbourne doesn't have enough houses, but the plan to fix it will change Australia's largest city forever

image.altText: Joan Baez smiles at the bottom of the stairs at a government building, a large line of police stands at the top.

props.synopsis: The revered folk singer's documentary reveals her toughest relationships and the internal battle she has waged constantly since childhood.

title.children: On the surface, Joan Baez was an icon. Beneath it all, she was living an unbearable struggle
